abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the State Modernization
            Project for Argentina were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            moderate, the Bank performance was moderately satisfactory,
            and the Borrower performance was also moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:  the process of
            altering the structure and functioning of the public
            administration to ultimately increase the efficacy,
            efficiency, and transparency of the state is, by nature, an
            arduous and long-term process. In this context, it is
            important to fully capitalize on windows of opportunity for
            drastic change and to 'keep going' during periods
            when only incremental and gradual change is feasible. As
            demonstrated by Argentina's experience since the
            crisis, public sector modernization can also be tackled
            gradually, in strategically chosen areas that build upon and
            scale up early results. This implies an incremental approach
            that envisages public sector modernization as a series of
            carefully sequenced and targeted series of steps, seizing
            windows of opportunity in those areas where government
            ownership is high. The project's implementation was
            severely affected by the unstable macroeconomic conditions
            that prevailed in the late 1990s and eventually resulted in
            the country's collapse in December 2001. By keeping the
            operation alive in the aftermath of the crisis, the Bank
            succeeded in maintaining modernization efforts on the public
            agenda, although actual progress was initially very slow.

9838962.trustfund:
TF037925-ARGENTINA - ARG YEAR 2000,TF040703-LATIN AMERICA:FINANCIAL
            MANAGEMENT OF PUBLIC SECTOR MODERNIZATION

repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - State Modernization Project -
            proposed amendment to the loan agreement

abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed amendment to the loan
            agreement aims at modifying the project design and
            development objective (PDO) in the original operation, as
            well as its comprehensive approach, to make it consistent
            with, and supportive of, the Government's incremental
            strategy for strengthening the efficiency, effectiveness,
            and impact of Argentina's services in selected
            agencies, and strengthen the management tools of selected
            public entities. Following the economic crisis in 2002-2003,
            the new administration has opted for an approach of
            "strategic incrementals" in its efforts to improve
            governance and public sector performance. This approach is
            based on the promotion of "islands of innovation"
            that provide replicable examples for the undertaking of
            effective governance reforms. In this context, the
            Government and the Bank agreed to a series of Action Plans
            (for CY2004 and CY2005-2006) in order to implement the State
            Modernization Project, thus reflecting this new incremental
            strategy and improve overall project implementation. The
            proposed amendment would also provide for the introduction
            of a new component, fully consistent with the revised
            Project Development Objective of the Loan, which consists of
            the initiation of the second phase of the Social and Fiscal
            National Identification System (SINTyS) program, supported
            under an APL operation the first phase, and successfully
            implemented under Loan 4459-AR. The proposed amendment
            complies with the Articles of Agreement of the Bank, and it
            is thus recommended to approve amending the loan agreement
            in accordance with the terms of this document.

5086032.trustfund:
TF040703-LATIN AMERICA:FINANCIAL
            MANAGEMENT OF PUBLIC SECTOR MODERNIZATION,TF037925-ARGENTINA - ARG YEAR 2000

repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - Year Two Thousand Technical
            Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Year 2000 Technical Assistance
            Project assists the government of Argentina on an urgent
            basis to contain the disruption in the country's social
            and economic infrastructure that would be caused by the
            failure of critical central government systems to process
            dates properly after December 31, 1999 (the "Y2K
            problem"). There are three components. The first
            finances support activities, some of which are ongoing such
            as initial estimates of entities and systems at risk; an
            assessment of common approaches, tools, and methodologies to
            be used; a publicity campaign using various media;
            acquisition, provision, and training in the use of tools and
            methodologies; and development of common administrative
            systems. The second component provides technical assistance
            to agencies to carry out Y2K diagnostics, technical and
            impact analysis, preparing implementation plans, preparing
            terms of reference and supervision of consulting firms, and
            preparing equipment specifications. The third component
            funds activities typical of a project's coordination
            and administration.
